hanzi-su-wiki:
郷

Значения

Сельская местность, провинция

Мнемоника

По бокам — город ⻏ в прямом и зеркальном отображении, в центре — «еда» 良. Деревни расположены между городами и обеспечивают их пищей.

Варианты

鄕, 乡, 鄉, 鄊
purpleculture_pinyin:
xiāng
Japanese variant of 乡
Японский вариант Township
rtega_mnemonic:
鄕鄕RS
乡乡		鄉郷鄊country, rural, village
  • area 阝 with a line 乡 of seeds 皀: country side village
  • 鄕 → 郷
heisig_constituent: home town, cocoon, silver, city walls
Keyword_KANJIDIC: home town, village, native place, district
koohiiStory1: Your hometown is where you broke out of your cocoon (born), and where you left when your hair was silver (died), your whole life was spent inside the city walls.
koohiiStory2: Your home town is where you earned enough silver to enable you to break out of your giant cocoon (leave home) and explore outside the city walls.
jp_example_words:
郷愁(きょうしゅう): nostalgia, homesickness
郷里(きょうり): birth-place, home town
故郷(こきょう): home town, birthplace, old or historic village
jp_readingExamples: 郷里 (きょうり), 郷土 (きょうど), 異郷 (いきょう)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Everyone has a poop guy from their hometown. You know. That poop guy. And every single time you try to visit your hometown, poop guy is there making everyone uncomfortable and reminding you why you left in the first place.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture the poop guy from your hometown. Picture him really vividly. The awkward, rude things he does. The way he smells. The way he makes you never want to come back.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Your hometown is in きょうとう which, unfortunately, means your poop guy is in きょうとう too. Now every time you go back home he's there stinking everything up.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine all the wonderful things that exist in your hometown of きょうとう. All the things you love to do and see. And now picture poop guy. Ruining it all with his poop hands.
Ru_Meaning: home town, village, native place, district
Ru_Radicals: 幺 (короткая нить), 邦 (родная страна), 艮 (северо-восток)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the short thread (乡) of husbands (郎) is in your hometown

郷字的基本解释

郷
xiāng
古同“乡”。

郷字的汉语字典释义

[①]［xiāng］
［《廣韻》許良切，平陽，曉。］
“乡1”的繁体字。亦作“郷1”。亦作“鄊1”。“鄕1”的新字形。
(1)基层行政区划名。后指县以下的农村基层行政单位。（1）周制，一万二千五百家为乡。《周礼·地官·大司徒》：“令五家爲比，使之相保；五比爲閭，使之相受；四閭爲族，使之相葬；五族爲黨，使之相救；五黨爲州，使之相賙；五州爲鄉，使之相賓。”郑玄注：“鄉萬二千五百家。”《庄子·逍遥游》：“故夫知效一官，行比一鄉，德合一君，而徵一國者，其自視也亦若此矣。”成玄英疏：“鄉是萬二千五百家也。”《汉书·食货志上》：“五家爲鄰，五鄰爲里，四里爲族，五族爲黨，五黨爲州，五州爲鄉。鄉，萬二千五百户也。”（2）春秋齐制，郊内二千家为一乡。《国语·齐语》：“五家爲軌，軌爲之長；十軌爲里，里有司；四里爲連，連爲之長；十連爲鄉，鄉有良人焉。”又：“管子於是制國以爲二十一鄉。”韦昭注：“二千家爲一鄉。”又郊外三千家为一乡。《国语·齐语》：“制鄙：三十家爲邑，邑有司；十邑爲卒，卒有卒帥；十卒爲鄉，鄉有鄉帥。”《管子·小匡》：“制五家爲軌，軌有長；六軌爲邑，邑有司；十邑爲率，率有長；十

The ancient "township".

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［xiāng］
["Guangyun" Xu Liangqie, Pingyang, Xiao. ]
Traditional characters for "乡1". Also known as "Yi 1". Also known as "鄊1". The new glyph of "鄕1".
(1) The name of the basic administrative division. Later refers to rural grassroots administrative units below the county level. (1) Weekly system, 12,500 homes are hometowns. "Zhou Li·Diguan·Da Situ": "Let the five families be the comparison, so that they can protect each other; the five comparisons are the Lu, so that they can be accepted; the four Lu is the clan, so that they are buried; the five clans are the party, so that it Help each other; the five parties serve as the state, so that they can be reciprocated; the five states are the township, so that they can be friends." Zheng Xuan's note: "The township has two thousand and five hundred families." "Zhuangzi·Xiaoyaoyou": "The old husband knows the effects. An official is more than a township, and a ruler of morality, and those who conquer a country will regard themselves as such." Cheng Xuanying said: "The township is two thousand and five hundred families." "Han Shu·Shihuo "The First Chronicle": "Five families are neighbors, five neighbors are neighbors, four miles are clans, five clans are parties, five parties are states, and five states are townships. Townships are two thousand five hundred households." (2) Spring and Autumn Qi system, two thousand families in the suburbs are one township. "Guoyu·Qiyu": "Five schools are the tracks, and the tracks are long; ten tracks are li, and there are divisions in the mile; four li are ties, and lians are long; ten lians are the township, and the township has good people." And: "So Guanzi thought that the country was 21 townships." Wei Zhao's note: "Two thousand families make one township." Another three thousand outskirts make one township. "Mandarin·Qiyu": "Systematic: Thirty schools are towns, and towns have divisions; ten towns are pawns, and pawns are commanders; ten pawns are townships, and there are townsmen." "Guanzi·Xiao Kuang": "System Five schools are the track, and the track has long; the sixth track is the town, and the town has the division; ten towns are the rate, and the rate has the long; ten

xiāng
яп. вм. 乡
Radicals: 幺, 郎  (poop, guy)
Meaning Mnemonic
Everyone has a poop guy from their hometown. You know. That poop guy. And every single time you try to visit your hometown, poop guy is there making everyone uncomfortable and reminding you why you left in the first place.
Picture the poop guy from your hometown. Picture him really vividly. The awkward, rude things he does. The way he smells. The way he makes you never want to come back.
Reading Mnemonic
Your hometown is in きょうとう which, unfortunately, means your poop guy is in きょうとう too. Now every time you go back home he's there stinking everything up.
Imagine all the wonderful things that exist in your hometown of きょうとう. All the things you love to do and see. And now picture poop guy. Ruining it all with his poop hands.
